name: Shone
note: <cgmzdesc: A pain in the ass. I swear he's everywhere. He's not a big threat usually...>

name: Gnome
note: <cgmzdesc:What even is this? I've never seen such a type of gnome before. It's kind of gross... and I haven't a clue why it's so hostile!>

name: Crow
note: <cgmzdesc:That STUPID BIRD that I hate. They only attack. They literally have no other moves. Just there to be annoying. Where else but here, I suppose?>

name: Lizard Drone
note: <cgmzdesc:Some dumb drone Scilio made, hence the name "Lizard Drone" despite it having no resemblance to lizards besides being green. It's not a hazard, but he's probably spying through it.>

name: R.M. Delphox
note: <cgmzdesc:Scilio's "Right-Hand Lady" as most call her. She's like an honorary higher-up of sorts as she seems to get more recognition than Scilio's other robots. Couldn't tell you why. Perhaps she just listens the best.>

name: Sparkling Lizard
note: <cgmzdesc:Some silly lizard. They are native to Beam Plains and one of its most well-known species due to them being solely in that area and having such a distinct glitter to their body! They are, however, very loud and annoying, so residents of the area are NOT fond of them.>

name: Searcher Bee
note: <cgmzdesc:The fact Scilio put these robots out so quickly is astonishing to me. I also don't get what his plan is... if he wants to kill us so badly why didn't he put our starting point in his castle? Did he make a mistake? Didn't he make this game?>

name: Shocking Hare
note: <cgmzdesc:A weirdly oversized electric rodent. Surprisingly not yellow. I wonder if they come in red? Either way, very bothersome and shocking. Especially for poor ol' Hollvor... I think he's a bit weak to electricity.>

name: Giant Mysterious Creature
note: <cgmzdesc:Why the fuck is there a big Eevee here? How did it get to such a size? I think someone may have made a mistake. Not too unlike Scilio, after all... what else would I expect from someone who hit their head falling off a tree?>

name: "Rat"
note: <cgmzdesc:First thing's first, this is the weirdest "rat" I've ever seen. Charles is off his rocker. Why does he have a dungeon basement anyways? I digress, their coiling move is super annoying, as defensive upgrades for enemies usually are...>

name: Wandering Spirit
note: <cgmzdesc:The only thing wierder than the "rats," these freaky spirits are plentiful and annoying! High evasion, resistance to the burning state, AND they can cast darkness. What a bother.>

name: Mimic
note: <cgmzdesc:A staple in RPGs. Weirdly tough, but at least they're a lil' weak to flames and light! Just don't strike with magic when they close up.>

name: Greater Spirit
note: <cgmzdesc:The grand spirit, even though it's just a slightly different shade in color. It has less evasion which is nice, but it has life drain, and can poison! On top of that it has the same darkness move. What a weird creature. I wonder what it's even doing here...>

name: Egotistical Sea Monkey
note: <cgmzdesc:I couldn't tell you what this is. Not even Hollvor knows, and he comes from the ocean! Perhaps they recently got a new sea monkey military...?>

name: R.M. Raichu
note: <cgmzdesc:First the shocking hares, and now the massive shocking rat! I've admittedly always found Scilio's Raichu bot to be rather cute, even if it's always trying to kill me and acting like a huge overly excited child. If it wasn't so rabid, I'd ask it if it wanted to play Minecraft with me some time... if it could even hold a controller.>

name: Cacturrt
note: <cgmzdesc:What a dumb looking cactus monster. It is, however, quite interesting! As they age they grow more and more thorns around their body, and when under attack, they suck the thorn in and shoot it out their mouth! Don't ask me to explain their mana drain ability, though.>

name: Scorpy
note: <cgmzdesc:Really, this thing is just a scorpion. A scorpion that does NOT get along. It always kicks around sand so rudely. So crudely. You'd wonder who pissed in their cereal, but at the end of the day, it was really just themselves.>

name: Dry Wolf
note: <cgmzdesc:A big bad wolf is one thing, but a big bad DRY wolf? Expect it to be a lot more desperate... thank goodness they aren't pack animals, right? Maybe if they were though, cacturrt's wouldn't be a problem, as they often prey on younger ones before they form their thorns.>

name: Sand Fairy
note: <cgmzdesc:A strange mystical creature of the sand, these things have unknown origins. They certainly aren't from Santotierra, and they certainly aren't biological. I could only presume they have some weird relation with the wandering spirit... because with that tornado attack they're EQUALLY as annoying!>

name: Good Knight
note: <cgmzdesc:Another mystical creature, this thing has the same magical essence as the sand fairy, which leads it to be commonly believed that the sand fairies formed them. They must really not like us on their land. Anywho, no, it did not get its name because it's "good," it got it because it quite literally says goodnight to you in the form of a heavy swinging attack that usually knocks people out. Terrifying, to say the least.>

name: Egotistical Sea Monkey
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Shadel
note: <cgmzdesc:Uriel's yucky goons! What are they doing in the desert?! They're normally just in Forsaken Valley as those two weirdos go hand-in-hand, but the weird zone is making them spread over. What is that dastardly shadowy fellow planning?! I hate these feral beasts...>

name: General Gekkon
note: <cgmzdesc:Scilio's military general for his Sceptabot army, taking on the form of a massive dragon, perhaps just to try and scare us... but we're stronger than that. This guy usually has 9 Sceptabots behind him, but I guess they really are on a budget! I guess we are too, as we can't knock back that grenade like we usually do... sometimes I hate this game.>

name: Sceptabot
note: <cgmzdesc:Scilio's mainline offensive units. They really got a glowdown if you ask me... normally they have cool backpacks and visors, but here? They're just lime and weird looking. Lame! Can't lie though, they are more of a bother than usual...>

name: Porygon
note: <cgmzdesc:The weirdobots that contribute to how Steel Beach got its name. For some reason if you're a hero then bits of steel will rise from the ground and form together to make these things. I don't know if they've just been waiting to reactivate or if they get sent up from something deep below, but they are inconvenient to say the least... and they have the gall to kick sand in your eyes! Disrespectful.>

name: Kelp Krab
note: <cgmzdesc:Pointless little creature. They know not much beyond eating and covering themselves in kelp. And uh, shooting jets of water I suppose... but that's about it. Just a nuisance at the end of the day. They should stick to what they're good at.>

name: Salty Siren
note: <cgmzdesc:A strange mystical angry lady of the sea. They're so rare there are few recordings of her... although to be fair that's probably just because most die when they see her. I don't see the appeal in her though... sirens usually lure folks in, but this lady doesn't even try, and even if she did her lips are all salty... she sure has quite a bit of moola though!!!>

name: Porygon
note: <cgmzdesc:Is... is this a shiny?! How lucky are we?! Wow! We're gonna be rich! Ah... if only we could catch it though.>

name: Succubus
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Peculiar Beach Duck
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Angry Beach Duck
note: <cgmzdesc:This thing is just plain ugly. And on top of that it has some real anger issues... like what other enemy gets so mad it sweeps a whole party for no reason?! Then again, if some random loser came up to me and hit me with a sword, I'd be pretty upset too... but it came at us first!>

name: Shone
note: <cgmzdesc:Great... this guy again. What a pain in the ass! First in the forest and then he starts scheming on the beach?! I really hope we never see him again. Isn't he like, some sort of creation of Uriel? Shouldn't he be off dicking around with him, wherever the hell he is? I know he has some fork in this story.>

name: Raphael
note: <cgmzdesc:Raphael, Shone's little rookie or whatever. I never understood their relationship. Apparently Shone found Raphael abandoned in the woods, lost and looking for help, and he decided to take him in and accept him as though he were family. Bla bla bla, I don't know, I just know Raphael is TERRIFYINGLY strong. His magic abilities may generally be lacking, but he sure gets real physical real quick... maybe that's why Shone was so quick to recruit him?>

name: Wishan
note: <cgmzdesc:Forsaken's happy-go-lucky brother. He usually doesn't show it, but I know he loves him. I mean, who wouldn't love Wishan? I almost feel bad beating him up, but it's his choice to be here, not mine!>

name: Awesome Sea Monkey
note: <cgmzdesc:1 monkey, 2 monkeys, green monkey... uh, also green monkey? I really don't see the biggest difference outside of stats and a handful of moves. Didn't he say he's awesome and different, or is he just as egotistical for going by such a title? Are we all egotistical at the end of the day for thinking we're something? Maybe I'm overthinking this too much... I hate these dumb monkeys.>

name: Typhlosion
note: <cgmzdesc:This. Guy. Is. EVERYWHERE. Not in this story, but... first adventure? He's there? Next adventure, also there. Try to play a fighting game? He's there too! He's so weird. Someone has to be messing with me... regardless of his annoying, I do respect his determination. We should all strive to be as determined as him, I believe.>

name: Galomez
note: <cgmzdesc:Never seen this bloke in my life. I reckon he's the knight of Maldred! Some figure they look up to to protect the town. I mean, these places need defensive measures after all, right? We did kinda leave their gate open...>

name: Anexela
note: <cgmzdesc:What a freak. A freak with a DEATH CAST that has a chance of INSTANTLY KILLING US!!! And she has no weaknesses, outside of having not much health. I suppose I should know better than to expect death to have a way to counter it... speaking of death, where is Defeilu in all this?>

name: Jackycha
note: <cgmzdesc:What a bother. Who makes their main way of fighting to just be a dodging douche? They don't even do it well. Where did they even come from, and where do they go?>

name: Big Flamingo
note: <cgmzdesc:I could only assume this is Maldred's local fighting champion. Loads of HP, high hit rate, loudly exclaims all of his moves in Spanish... yep, has to be local. He's pretty cool though... I respect his style.>

name: Recybomb
note: <cgmzdesc:A weird bomb of the lab that fires out lasers from its eye and, when below 25% HP, decides to just blast out a burst of energy that does a lot of damage to... well, everyone. Sounds scary, but if you're quick enough, it shouldn't be an issue! Shouldn't... er, I really don't like how it stares at me.>

name: Porygon2
note: <cgmzdesc:The evolution to Porygon, really just screams that the Porygon come from the lab, and I guess the ones kept here are upgraded to be home defenders. They're actually sort of cute...>

name: Porygon2
note: <cgmzdesc:Another shiny, how quaint! These brothers of blue sure are pretty. I would love to have one of these for my own home, looking all pretty and cool, and blasting anyone that breaks in with a good ol' Triple Attack and Spark II... then again, scratch that, that'd wreck the place. Hollvor's upset enough as is after the duck incident...>

name: Lab Worker
note: <cgmzdesc:These look strikingly similar to Scilio's searcher drones. Perhaps inspiration? Or just laziness? Did he rip these from Santotierra or re-use assets? I think I'll call him lazy either way, just for the hell of it. Also, the stingers on these things FREAK ME OUT. It looks like it's gonna stab halfway through me and pump me with poison. Yuck...>

name: Firewall Pawniard
note: <cgmzdesc:Oh... this thing. I feel like I've seen this somewhere before. I don't get it, did it come from another planet, another dimension, or is there a magical hologram machine hidden somewhere playing tricks on us? I don't think I'll ever understand.>

name: Firewall Famine
note: <cgmzdesc:I saw this creature in a game somewhere. I just know it. Really makes you wonder where it gets these foes from, and still wonder how it even exists. It has to be physical in some way... it literally starves us of our MP!>>

name: Firewall Antonia
note: <cgmzdesc:This is just WRONG. This is literally somebody I've met in person! Is it getting these creatures from our minds?! AND WHAT'S UP WITH ALL THE BIRDS IN THIS BEACH AREA?!>

name: Failed Prototype
note: <cgmzdesc:I had a friend eons ago that sorta resembled this thing. I can't remember if they were a robot though.. but I know they looked very similar to this. The implications are freaking me out.>

name: Mech Lucario
note: <cgmzdesc:I feel bad for this guy. It feels like every other year he has some weird accident going on that makes him suddenly go rogue. I wish I could be better friends with him. I know that if he was here right now he'd offer to go out to the beach and have a picnic... and I'd so say yes. Hell, I bet he'd offer to come with on our journey!>

name: It Lives?
note: <cgmzdesc:A rather large monstrosity with a very weird and largely unknown past. I couldn't even tell you much about it myself, I just know it's been living in this facility for years sucking up juices and laying dormant. I don't wanna know what it's been doing or what it's been planning, as it's clearly malevolent in some way... as are most infants. I honestly initially presumed it acted as the core for the facility, but the place was still running after its death. I suppose it was more of an experiment...>

name: Beach Babe
note: <cgmzdesc:Don't even ask me what her deal is... she makes me uncomfortable, especially with that draining kiss! What does she want from me?!>

name: Beach Dude
note: <cgmzdesc:Why do women only like stupid jerks who treat them like shit? And what is this guys deal too... does he think he owns the place?>

name: Ditto
note: <cgmzdesc:Oh... well ain't that something. These things are like a pest, and the worst kind too as you never know if they're hiding right under your nose! You could think "Oh what a cute duck" and it's just one of these freaks getting their rocks off to being a little hiding in plain sight type of bitch.>

name: Porygon
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: R.M. Rhydon
note: <cgmzdesc:Genuinely? This guy scares me. Every third turn he unleashes a drill rush and goes almost right through you! Certainly one of Scilio's more formidable men, and his second best demolitionist... yet here he is drilling the beach all day. Wouldn't Stone Beach be better for him?>

name: Otherworldly Goat
note: <cgmzdesc:What a mystical fellow! I almost want him as my mentor. As long as he stops ramming me every 4 turns, that is... just plain impolite.>

name: Super "Rat"
note: <cgmzdesc:Still... still not a rat. Who does he think he is?!>

name: Iron Unicornia
note: <cgmzdesc:I'm just plain uncomfortable around this thing. It's so pretty, but it can also stay like 10 feet away from me at all times... pretty sure electricity and ice are pretty effective against it... man, I'm getting quite hungry!>

name: Bacon
note: <cgmzdesc:His name is familiar, not just because it's a food item though... perhaps he comes from another universe, in a time I know not... yet would also find familiar at the same time... eh, nah, that's a load of hoopla I bet. He's pretty stunning though, even if he seems to resist the state...>

name: Marowak
note: <cgmzdesc:What an annoying little beast, I wanna put its fire out real quick! I'd feel sorta bad though. The non-feral ones can do such cool tricks! Hell, even these guys can do cool tricks, even if they usually end with them hitting me over the head with their dumb bones. Where do they even get those anyways?! They make them resistant to fire. I sorta want one...>

name: Cubone
note: <cgmzdesc:Cute! Until they throw rocks at you, that is... then it's not so cute, huh? At least swiping attacks are super effective as they haven't much health.>

name: Roohound
note: <cgmzdesc:Such fearsome stone hounds... they're local to Forsaken Valley, but sometimes you see them in caves too! Interestingly enough their home dictates their texture. Makes you think: are they made of the rocks, or are they simply covered in a rocky shell?>

name: Earth Worm!
note: <cgmzdesc:EARTH WORM!!! I remember sticking my toy swords into the ground as a kid and hitting the top of them to make vibrations and cause all of the lil' worms to come out... now our mere stepping is attracting these guys. Plain horrifying.>

name: True Mimic
note: <cgmzdesc:I kinda wonder what makes these guys more truthful than the previous ones. Were the previous ones just made by Charles or something, and these are natural ones? Why are there even more mimics?? Perhaps such is purely the nature of Forsaken Valley, or maybe Forsaken is just fucking with us.>

name: Chattering Tome
note: <cgmzdesc:This thing won't stop yapping, but its pattern is really simple. Like, it legit does the same pattern over and over. It's quite a blabblemouth. It repeats the same pattern of attacks. It's a little babbler. It repeats itself every four turns. What is it even talking about?>

name: Jackycha
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Tressie
note: <cgmzdesc:Hm... I'm gonna assume her favorite number has to be 5. I was gonna guess 4, but that's generally considered an unlucky number. Who would like 4?!>

name: Gilliad
note: <cgmzdesc:Oh, Gilliad, an interesting guy he is... I wish he could come with us, as he's so nimble and noble, but unfortunately his curse of having an abnormally high metabolism makes him unable to go far... and he'd probably eat through our items real quick. I wonder what he's even doing here...>

name: Greater Spirit
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Purple Eyes
note: <cgmzdesc:What a weird cool dragon! Why are these guys so much more hostile than the NPC ones? And electric, too... at least it's not an earth or dark magic one. I'm certain Fizzy would've loved a fire one.>

name: Unnecessary Sphere
note: <cgmzdesc:This thing feels so out of place. Who even put it here?! Has to be Scilio's doing. It's so strange though... who would even bother with such a design? Its only pro is its ability to roll over us, which is admittedly kinda scary.>

name: FLARBON
note: <cgmzdesc:A mortifying presence to tremble before... usually only ever seen out of bounds... with a voice that booms and echoes through the land... I'm gonna be honest, I think I wet myself in the middle of that fight.>

name: Magmista
note: <cgmzdesc:A lava guardian for Forsaken, said to be made by accident when Forsaken dropped a bag of magic dust in a lava lake, hence the name "MagMISTA." He's been his outside guard ever since! And always comes back, since he is kind of the lava and all...>

name: Gallade
note: <cgmzdesc:A knight loyal to Forsaken. It is unknown why they're so loyal to him. The running theory is that they were made with some form of magic. Either way, they're very well behaved and coordinated! They only attack you.>

name: Recybomb Sr.
note: <cgmzdesc:Woah, an upgrade... now they do an upgraded blast when below 33% HP, and they're more likely to do it?! What a nightmare! At least everything else they do is... kinda weak. Forsaken really got lousy with this one, eh?>

name: Hero Statue
note: <cgmzdesc:What a big freak. Although, saying that is rather disrespectful, as they seem to be modeled after heros of the past. Then again, only MODELED after them, so definitely still a freak!!>

name: Angry Worker
note: <cgmzdesc:What the hell are these guys doing?! Are they actually upset about our intrusion, or ar they being controlled by some greater force? Some of them are chill, so the latter seems plausible... I don't see how else their yelling and grumbling would weaken us.>

name: Sandeon
note: <cgmzdesc:Another magical creature of the desert that gathers sand to make itself a form to fight us with. They're very interesting, as halfway through the fight they'll just randomly decide to take on the form of another foe... how they do it so accurately is beyond me.>

name: Glasseon
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Burning Hare
note: <cgmzdesc:So there is a red one?! That's like, totes radical! I know Fizzler is quite excited about it, in spite of its... annoying fire resistance. The unfortunate thing about these neat creatures is that they're still enemies and must go down all the same.>

name: Luxo
note: <cgmzdesc:I swear I've seen this guy in the past, and I never know if he's really on our side or not. One moment he's attacking, next moment he's super chill. We have a common enemy at least, so I know he doesn't completely have it out for us... wish I could get to know him more.>

name: Fortress Ghoul
note: <cgmzdesc:I could've sworn these fellas were native to the Limbo where Defeilu resides. Why the hell does Forsaken have them up here?! They're so... gloomy and sad. I feel like they don't even want to defend the place. Their high defense sure does make them quite the unit though... and that physical attack resistance? Sigh...>

name: Mistake
note: <cgmzdesc:Flat out gross. What is this thing doing in the vent?! Now that I look at it closer, it kinda looks like a Jirachi itself. Was Forsaken working with Uriel on something dastardly? Or maybe they weren't... I do recall Forsaken had another brother that passed away recently. Maybe that's why he has all the other Jirachi about...? They do somewhat remind me of him.>

name: Impostor
note: <cgmzdesc:Something's... suspicious about this enemy, but I can't tell what.>

name: Blinky
note: <cgmzdesc:What a strange creature. It almost feels as though it's from another universe. It's based off of the species Hollvor is originally of, and it seems to be made completely of stone! Yet, it's also not stone-like? And it's... eerily patient. It feels like it's always looking through me, as though it knows me and what I've done... judging silently.>

name: Improper Janitor
note: <cgmzdesc:These weirdos are janitors? They're so clumsy and gross. Is that even water in their buckets that they carry around? Or is it... something nastier? Eugh... how do them and the chefs get along so well?>

name: Forsaken
note: <cgmzdesc:Well that happened. Despite my anger towards him in the moment I feel... bad considering recent events. I honestly should be nicer to him in general all things considered. We can certainly both relate on the... mother situation. I just wish he would accept reality for what it is and move on, though. Life is hard, but not accepting that can be harder.>

name: Molteon
note: <cgmzdesc:Another creature of molten rock. Quite curious! Although this one is certainly scarier and much more dangerous. Its ability to transform into enemies we've seen provides much more threat, as rather than using surrounding enemies it goes into our minds... weird!>

name: R.M. Hoopla
note: <cgmzdesc:Definitely one of Scilio's weirder robots, this guy was fucking with our heads the whole fight! Changing our looks, names, hell even warping in some random guy... if that even actually happened. You can never tell what's real around him. Wish he just stuck with teleportation magic, holy hell! Wondering what other robo masters he's bringing back to fuck with us.>

name: Luxo
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Transitioning Shork
note: <cgmzdesc:I feel violated by this creature. Why the hell is it able to transform into our original selves?! Why does IT get to be us? And why is it even transforming in the first place... everything about it is awful! Fizzler seems to really like it though for some reason. Guess some people just have... weird tastes. She says it's "Literally her" which makes no fucking sense.>

name: Pseudo Silvon
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Pseudo Fizzler
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Pseudo Hollvor
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Boop
note: <cgmzdesc:This strange thing doesn't seem physical, yet I can certainly still hit it. It's almost like most of its form is electric goop... do you think if I threw a lightning bolt and yelled "fetch!" it would go after it?>

name: Firewall Lagona
note: <cgmzdesc:Oh, Lagona... not only did we have to fight this dumb thing, but we also had to be reminded of you. Most forget you, and I admittedly forgot how you passed away, but I miss you, even if we never talked much. Makes me wish I took the opportunity to talk to you more.>

name: Firewall Kannatori
note: <cgmzdesc:Isn't this... one of those "Emotion Guardian" things? I was confused at first as to why we were never encountering them, but I suppose there is no reason for any Emotion Sanctuaries to be hidden about here. Just big dumb robots laying waste to areas for Scilio so he can get a weird kick out of it. I wonder what those guardians are doing right now...>

name: Firewall Shine
note: <cgmzdesc:For fuck's sake, my sister... this has gone TOO FAR. I hate this dumb machine, wherever the hell it's even from. Wish it'd stay gone forever... I miss my sister.>

name: Static Porygon2
note: <cgmzdesc:This thing's out of damn control! I'm surprised it's the only robot left here, but I'm also glad it is. I can't imagine those stupid Kirlia bots being out of control...>

name: Swagger Bucket
note: <cgmzdesc:Who the fuck is this? He looks like those gross janitors, but he's trying to be "cooler." I'll give him this, he sure as hell is still annoying. He is NOT surfing up.>

name: Pokoral Head
note: <cgmzdesc:This sentient stack of coral looks so silly. I wonder what it's even happy about, or why it's looking at us like that? In-fact, I also wonder if the rest of the stack has minds of their own. They do persist after its death...>

name: Pokoral Top
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Pokoral Middle
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Pokoral Bottom
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Sharpedo
note: <cgmzdesc:Easily the most terrifying shark I've ever seen all thanks to it being PART TORPEDO. Being fast, having a powerful bite, and having the ability to explode are the three worst things to go together. Why the hell are we in this ocean, anyways?! It certainly doesn't want us in it.>

name: Dumb Sea Slug
note: <cgmzdesc:This thing looks plain dumb and so does everything it does. This has to be the most pathetic foe I've ever seen! Of course though, Fizzler thinks it's kind of cute. What the hell does she see in everything?>

name: Haunting Jelly
note: <cgmzdesc:Certainly, this beast must've come from the Limbo or something. It's so haunting, being around it makes me feel pessimistic and sorrowful. It has such a strange dark energy to it. And its dark abilities definitely confirm that theory...>

name: Caster
note: <cgmzdesc:What a strange and terrifying blocky creature. Something about it brings me fear and yet also annoyance! Its trident is super cool though. The ability to cast lightning seems fun... if only that also came with the mobility it seems to have underwater.>

name: Napolmeron
note: <cgmzdesc:Napolmeron, Hollvor's father... known to be one of the most powerful creatures out there, but also one of the most passive. His patience is commendable, and his ability to stay in such a stance is impressive... I feel like him falling out of it mid-battle was just him going easy on us, too. Considering his power, it makes me wonder why he won't help us, but I reckon it's because he knows we can beat Scilio... which, hey, we've done it before many times!>

name: True Napolmeron
note: <cgmzdesc:Is Hollvor's mom even truly still alive? I wonder if this game is messing with us sometimes. I feel... weird... are we real? How does any of this even work?!>

name: Nightshade
note: <cgmzdesc:A cool club dude. Maybe even the coolest... like he just has this wave of coolness that comes off of him. God he's so cool. I wanna be just like him. He's my idol.>

name: Magiever
note: <cgmzdesc:These strange little things have always been a bother in this damn forest. At least they never get close to our house, but still... walking home and having one pester us... they've never attacked us before though! Must have something to do with Uriel. That damn bastard...>

name: Sadgiever
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Elite Crow
note: <cgmzdesc:These have to be the most foolish enemies ever. Hey guys, what if it was a bird, but it was grass element and instead of just knowing attack it knew DOUBLE ATTACK?! WOAH!>

name: Thrine
note: <cgmzdesc:Stepping on these by accident is awful! I wish they'd make their presence more known. Alas, they insist on staying hidden, making stepping on them inevitable if you're in the wrong part of the forest... I wonder though, a plant creature with sentience... how common is that? If you really think about it these things are super cool!>

name: Flammaferen
note: <cgmzdesc:A terrifying flame bot sent by Scilio to annihilate us. Doesn't seem too concerned with its job though. Sure it tries to kill us, but that cannon in its mouth gets used for smoking more than anything... Scilio must be pretty pissed about that.>

name: Chloe
note: <cgmzdesc:It's ridiculous at this point. I don't think this creature has any significance, they're just a sideshow in the grand scheme of things. A character from another play partaking in this one. Interesting, but nothing to be too concerned with... we just need to keep moving on.>

name: Slenderman?!
note: <cgmzdesc:We beat up a literal child and yet I don't even feel that bad. They were brats, after all.>

name: Paenitum
note: <cgmzdesc:I feel nauseous and off around this thing, as if the despair of the gods are being drippled down onto me. I don't think this thing was made with any good or holy intention. It doesn't belong. And yet, the longer I stay around it, the less I feel like I belong... I... I need to get my head in the game.>

name: Facade
note: <cgmzdesc:How does it do it? To create weaker forms of itself so easily... shadow magic is terrifying, and it's a good reminder that sometimes if you don't focus on what's important... well, things can appear scarier than they really are.>

name: Facade
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Withering Spirit
note: <cgmzdesc:A sad, lonely spirit that's wandering about this plane. I always wonder how they end up here. I suppose Bogmind Woods is pretty dark and empty, so perhaps they just have a natural draw here? Either way they freak me the fuck out... at least they don't make the first move.>

name: Magdow
note: <cgmzdesc:The strangest dark mage ever, although I feel like they look a bit different here. I suppose they are originally from Uriel's dimension, aren't they? I can't remember... I feel like my memory is fading in this place. I-I can definitely remember one thing though, fuck his stupid god damn chair!>

name: Shadow Mug
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Shadow Clock
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Shadow Brick
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Shadow Paint
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Shadow Chair
note: <cgmzencyclopediahide>

name: Umbraman
note: <cgmzdesc:A tall lanky creature from Uriel's dimension. Actually a bit of a commonplace freak there. It used to have bigger eyes and bloodied teeth, but I guess it's spent plentiful time here and has had its eyes shrink and the blood on it wash off. Or maybe it got absorbed into the darkness... eugh.>

name: Uriel
note: <cgmzdesc:A shadowy man everyone... well, mostly everyone fears. He is the maestro of the darkness, acting as a demigod for it to do what he desires. He uses it to travel about, attack, defend himself, and even hold his own "pocket dimension" of sorts. I've heard rumors passed that he isn't actually the darkness itself and was once a perfectly ordinary individual, but... not much proof to hold that theory together. I just know that he's one of our most frequent villains we have to deal with, alongside Scilio. What a nightmare... not for us though after all these years! We can take on just about damn anything.>

name: Gargantua Legs
note: <cgmzdesc:A massive mechanism maliciously meandering within the confines of the clocktower. The way it towers over prey with its hammer is terrifying, but nothing unusual for us! This thing is funny, though. I know the exact arcade game Scilio took this from. He's over here fucking up Santotierra when we could be playing Batalla together or something... oh, what a fucking fumble!>
